intro: Amellus madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar starfish plant, is a unique flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink. The plant has a succulent stem and fleshy, lance-shaped leaves that help it store water in its arid native habitat. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements. Amellus madagascariensis thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light.
